intro: Browallia roezlii, commonly known as the Zambesi browallia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Browallia roezlii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a container plant.
